note.p: Scottish clergyman and botanist. LL.D., University of Aberdeen, 1858. Served the London Missionary Society in St Petersburg, Russia, and then in Cape Town, 1844–8. Minister to a United Presbyterian Church in Aberdeen, 1849. Lecturer in botany, Joint Medical School, Aberdeen, 1853. Colonial botanist, 1863–6, attending particularly to agricultural problems; also chair of botany at the South Africa College, Cape Town. Returned to his Aberdeen ministry in 1866. Fellow of the Linnean Society of London, 1867.
A. C. Brown 1977, p. 465, R. Desmond 1994, Gunn and Codd 1981.
